normalised: smart meter rollout gathers momentum in maharashtra

unnormalised: **Smart Meter Rollout Gathers Momentum in Maharashtra**
normalised: mumbai, twenty sixth october two thousand and twenty three – the maharashtra state electricity distribution company limited (m s e d c l) is accelerating its smart meter installation program across the state. the initiative, aimed at reducing transmission losses and improving billing accuracy, has seen significant progress in urban centers like pune and nagpur.

unnormalised: Mumbai, 26/10/2023 – The Maharashtra State Electricity Distribution Company Limited (MSEDCL) is accelerating its smart meter installation program across the state. The initiative, aimed at reducing transmission losses and improving billing accuracy, has seen significant progress in urban centers like Pune and Nagpur.
normalised: as of seventeen hundred hours today, over two point five lakh smart meters have been installed, with a target of one crore installations by two thousand and twenty five. m s e d c l chairman, mister rajesh sharma, stated, "this technology will empower consumers with real-time energy consumption data, allowing them to make informed decisions and conserve electricity.”

unnormalised: As of 17:00 hrs today, over 2.5 lakh smart meters have been installed, with a target of 1 crore installations by 2025. MSEDCL Chairman, Mr. Rajesh Sharma, stated, "This technology will empower consumers with real-time energy consumption data, allowing them to make informed decisions and conserve electricity.”
normalised: concerns regarding data privacy are being addressed through robust security protocols and compliance with regulatory guidelines. the project, funded in part by a rupee five thousand crore central government grant, is expected to bring down aggregate technical and commercial (a t and c) losses by fifteen percent in the next three years.

unnormalised: Concerns regarding data privacy are being addressed through robust security protocols and compliance with regulatory guidelines. The project, funded in part by a Rs. 5,000 crore central government grant, is expected to bring down Aggregate Technical & Commercial (AT&C) losses by 15% in the next three years.
normalised: consumer awareness campaigns are scheduled to run through december, explaining the benefits and functionalities of the new meters. a special helpline will be active from zero nine hundred hours to eighteen hundred hours daily, starting first november two thousand and twenty three, to address consumer queries. the pilot project in baramati is showing promising results, paving the way for wider implementation.

unnormalised: Consumer awareness campaigns are scheduled to run through December, explaining the benefits and functionalities of the new meters. A special helpline will be active from 09:00 hrs - 18:00 hrs daily, starting 01/11/2023, to address consumer queries. The pilot project in Baramati is showing promising results, paving the way for wider implementation.
